sections.doc_:
## Introduction

[`amp-sticky-ad`](/amp-dev/documentation/components/reference/amp-sticky-ad-v1.0.md) adds support for ad units that always take a fixed place in the viewport in your AMP HTML files.

The sticky ad will appear at the bottom of the page.
sections.cachedMarkedDoc:
Introduction

amp-sticky-ad adds support for ad units that always take a fixed place in the viewport in your AMP HTML files.

The sticky ad will appear at the bottom of the page.
sections.normalizedDoc_:
## Introduction

[`amp-sticky-ad`](/amp-dev/documentation/components/reference/amp-sticky-ad-v1.0.md) adds support for ad units that always take a fixed place in the viewport in your AMP HTML files.

The sticky ad will appear at the bottom of the page.

sections.doc_: Import the `amp-sticky-ad` component in the header.
sections.normalizedDoc_: Import the `amp-sticky-ad` component in the header.

sections.code:
<script async custom-element="amp-ad" src="https://cdn.ampproject.org/v0/amp-ad-0.1.js"></script>
<link rel="canonical" href="http://localhost:8080/documentation/examples/components/amp-sticky-ad/index.html">
<meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width,minimum-scale=1,initial-scale=1">
<style amp-boilerplate>body{-webkit-animation:-amp-start 8s steps(1,end) 0s 1 normal both;-moz-animation:-amp-start 8s steps(1,end) 0s 1 normal both;-ms-animation:-amp-start 8s steps(1,end) 0s 1 normal both;animation:-amp-start 8s steps(1,end) 0s 1 normal both}@-webkit-keyframes -amp-start{from{visibility:hidden}to{visibility:visible}}@-moz-keyframes -amp-start{from{visibility:hidden}to{visibility:visible}}@-ms-keyframes -amp-start{from{visibility:hidden}to{visibility:visible}}@-o-keyframes -amp-start{from{visibility:hidden}to{visibility:visible}}@keyframes -amp-start{from{visibility:hidden}to{visibility:visible}}</style><noscript><style amp-boilerplate>body{-webkit-animation:none;-moz-animation:none;-ms-animation:none;animation:none}</style></noscript>
<style amp-custom>
  .amp-sticky-ad-close-button {
    min-width: 0;
  }
  </style>
</head>
<body>

sections.doc_:
Use an `amp-ad` as a direct child of `amp-sticky-ad`. The height of the `amp-sticky-ad` will be determined based on the height of the `amp-ad` child.
The max-height of the sticky-ad is 100px, if the height exceeds 100px then the height would be 100px and overflow content will be hidden.
sections.normalizedDoc_:
Use an `amp-ad` as a direct child of `amp-sticky-ad`. The height of the `amp-sticky-ad` will be determined based on the height of the `amp-ad` child.
The max-height of the sticky-ad is 100px, if the height exceeds 100px then the height would be 100px and overflow content will be hidden.

sections.doc_:
`amp-sticky-ad` will display after scroll one viewport height from top provided there is at least one more viewport of content available. The text that follows is to ensure that there is another viewport from the first one on top.

document.head:
<meta charset="utf-8">
  <title>amp-sticky-ad</title>
  <script async src="https://cdn.ampproject.org/v0.js"></script>
  <script async custom-element="amp-sticky-ad" src="https://cdn.ampproject.org/v0/amp-sticky-ad-1.0.js"></script>
  <script async custom-element="amp-ad" src="https://cdn.ampproject.org/v0/amp-ad-0.1.js"></script>
  <link rel="canonical" href="http://localhost:8080/documentation/examples/components/amp-sticky-ad/index.html">
  <meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width,minimum-scale=1,initial-scale=1">
  <style amp-boilerplate>body{-webkit-animation:-amp-start 8s steps(1,end) 0s 1 normal both;-moz-animation:-amp-start 8s steps(1,end) 0s 1 normal both;-ms-animation:-amp-start 8s steps(1,end) 0s 1 normal both;animation:-amp-start 8s steps(1,end) 0s 1 normal both}@-webkit-keyframes -amp-start{from{visibility:hidden}to{visibility:visible}}@-moz-keyframes -amp-start{from{visibility:hidden}to{visibility:visible}}@-ms-keyframes -amp-start{from{visibility:hidden}to{visibility:visible}}@-o-keyframes -amp-start{from{visibility:hidden}to{visibility:visible}}@keyframes -amp-start{from{visibility:hidden}to{visibility:visible}}</style><noscript><style amp-boilerplate>body{-webkit-animation:none;-moz-animation:none;-ms-animation:none;animation:none}</style></noscript>
document.title: amp-sticky-ad
document._description: amp-sticky-ad adds support for ad units that always take a fixed place in the viewport in your AMP HTML files.
